title: Drawing, "The elevation of a mantelpiece", ca. 1775
medium: Black chalk, pen and black ink with brush and light brown washes
inscribed: Signed bottom left: "inv. J.C. Delafosse." Bottom margin: "Cheminee."
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux. In Decloux's coll. in 1906
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: A trophy of weapons is shown over the fireplace. The over mantel includes a mirror and an eagle holding an ovoidal medallion with an inscription in the top center.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "The elevation of a mantelpiece", ca. 1775.
ca. 1775. Black chalk, pen and black ink with brush and light brown washes. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-48.
